name: Splendor
premise: Players are merchants of the Renaissance trying to buy gem mines, transportation methods, and shops to acquire the most prestige points.
description: In Splendor, you lead a merchant guild. Using tokens representing gemstones, you will acquire developments which produce new gems (bonuses). These bonuses reduce the cost of your purchases and attract noble patrons.
total_playtime_notes: Playtime can vary slightly depending on the number of players.
session_playtime_notes: A single session typically lasts about 30 minutes.
immersiveness_level_notes: The focus of the game is more on mechanics rather than narrative or theme immersion.
learning_curve_notes: The game is easy to learn, making it a great entry point for people new to board games.
save_mechanism_notes: Not applicable for this type of game.
how_to_win: The player with the highest number of prestige points wins the game.
how_to_lose: Have fewer prestige points than the other players at the end of the game.

reasons: The game involves direct competition with other players.
The game rewards strategic planning and resource management.
The game involves strategic decision making.
There's a satisfaction in optimizing your moves and resources.

setup.footprint_notes: Requires some table space for cards and tokens, but not overly demanding.
setup.time_notes: Includes shuffling the cards and distributing tokens.
setup.complexity_notes: Setup is straightforward and takes little time.

rule_complexity_notes: Rules are easy to learn and teach.
mastery_curve_notes: While the game is easy to learn, it requires strategic planning to master.
additional_notes: Splendor is a great gateway game for those new to the hobby of board gaming.
unique_selling_point: Unique mechanic of purchasing cards to gain resources, which in turn help purchase further cards.
